title: 5 Step Steve
extra_info: Interesting little puzzle game where you die if you take more than 5 steps. The puzzles have very unique ideas and it even gets difficult. 3 playthroughs.

title: A Dance of Fire and Ice
extra_info: Fun rhythm game with cool ideas, especially in the DLC. Always trying to push a higher speed record is fun. Never explored custom maps, but they are also awesome.

title: AFK Angels
extra_info: An auto-battling game where collecting and upgrading your angels is the main gameplay. The game sadly shut down before I had the chance to fully level up my last few angels.

title: Afterimage
extra_info: One of the better metroidvanias with good combat and visuals. The world is almost too big however, and I got stuck a few times not knowing where to go.

title: Agar.io
extra_info: This game can be fun for a little while, but it's often just annoying when massive people constantly target you and you can't get any progress.

title: Among Us
extra_info: We all played this for a bit, we all enjoyed it with friends, nice times.

title: APB Reloaded
extra_info: I seriously did not even play this game for the gameplay, I just played around with the little music creator menu lol.

title: Apex Legends
extra_info: For being a battle royale, this one is actually good and quite fun. The vibe is cool and the sliding mechanic honestly bumps the game up from a 5 to a 6.

title: Arcaea
extra_info: I like the idea of this game, but it doesn't feel that smooth for some reason. I wish you could switch fingers on the hold notes, otherwise you almost have to play on a tablet using 16 fingers.

title: ARMS
extra_info: Definitely an over-hated game. The customization with the arms is great, and even the bots can get really hard at high difficulties.

title: Artist Idle
extra_info: A decent idle game where you draw a picture in progressively better resolution, and then sell them. But like many idle games, progress gets a bit slow after a while.

title: Assassin's Creed III
extra_info: Pretty fun game with some nice stealth missions and wild area exploration. The combat is however painfully easy, and the only thing you will die to is weird parkour sections or jank.

title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey
extra_info: Really fun game with great visuals, gameplay, and a cool story. The combat is actually good for once in the series, and I really liked the bounty hunter-like feature. Ship gameplay and combat isn't that special, but traveling between all the islands is very cool and cozy.

title: Astral Chain
extra_info: This game is so good. Combat with a legion works so well, and there are a lot of customizations for them. The story, gameplay, and music are peak. 4 playthroughs. Still missing 9 of Olive's cases and 2 other achievements until 100%, the endgame is very hard.

title: Atelier Ryza: Ever Darkness & the Secret Hideout
extra_info: Cute JRPG with a flowy style of combat. This game is just a nice and cozy experience.

title: Atelier Ryza 2: Lost Legends & the Secret Fairy
extra_info: Pretty good sequel, but I do prefer the island vibe of the first game rather than the city vibe in this game. Some endgame bosses also became way too hard for no reason.

title: Battle Run
extra_info: A fun little platform racing game with a bunch of items and nice movement.

title: Battlefield Heroes
extra_info: This game is a flash from the past, basically Team Fortress 2 but more real war oriented. The gameplay and the maps were so fun and the game just had a nice vibe to it.

title: Bayonetta
extra_info: Really fun game with great humor and ridiculousness. The combat feels perfect for the game, but the higher difficulties are stupid. 5+ playthroughs, including infinite climax difficulty. 99% because I am never beating Rodin or the angel slayer chapter.

title: Bayonetta 2
extra_info: I need to give this game some playthroughs on harder difficulties to be able to compare it to the original. The game is however awesome and wicked, just like a bayonetta game should be.

title: Bayonetta 3
extra_info: For being such a late entry in the series, it holds up surprisingly well and still feels super fun and interesting.

title: Beat the Boss 4
extra_info: A game where you completely murder a dude with a variety of weapons. Unlocking new characters is fun, but the game gets repetitive.

title: Bike Race
extra_info: Really fun 2D racing game where you play against ghosts instead of interactable vehicles. The main flaw is the pay-to-win aspect of getting the fastest bikes and using them to destroy people in online races.

title: Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg
extra_info: A really cute game where you roll around a giant egg while doing a bunch of tasks and just have fun really.

title: Bitcoin Billionaire
extra_info: Quite a fun but simple clicker game, can't say much more about it.

title: Bloons Pop!
extra_info: A bloons spin-off game that is a great way to pass time. More than anything, it's just very satisfying to pop all the bloons on the screen.

title: Bomb Chicken
extra_info: Cute little game, but it could use more bosses since there are only 2, and the normal gameplay gets a bit boring after a while. 2 playthroughs.

title: Bomb It (1-6)
extra_info: This game series is practically a bomberman rip-off, but with some cute characters and stuff. It was very fun to play multiplayer with friends and my brothers.

title: Bomb Party
extra_info: A spelling game where you and a bunch of opponents have to write a word with a specific string of letters in them. It's very fun until you run into try-hards using the most complex words ever and who know all letter combinations already.

title: Borderlands 2
extra_info: Such an amazing time to play. The characters, guns, areas, and story are all so good, and peak DLCs. The replayability is also off the scale with all the different weapons. 3 playthroughs with Zer0, Maya, and Salvador.

title: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
extra_info: Very fun game that's similar enough to borderlands 2 to be awesome, but different enough to feel different. I have no real reason to why I dropped the game, other stuff just got in the way I guess.

title: Borderlands 3
extra_info: Not on the same level as Borderlands 2, but the combat might still be better. Technically don't have 100% because 2 red chests are missable for no reason.

title: Bouncy Ball
extra_info: Classic bouncy platformer game. Very simple controls and ideas, but the levels always keeps it interesting and fun.

title: Brawlhalla
extra_info: Me and my brother played this in anticipation for smash bros ultimate. I would say this is the best 2D fighter outside of the smash bros games.

title: Burrito Bison Revenge
extra_info: You are a wrestler who launches themself far while crushing gummybears and avoiding police, what more can you want.

title: Bygg Båtar med Mulle Meck
extra_info: A swedish children's game that has so much charm looking back at it. I always got stuck driving the boat under bridges and never understood how to continue.

title: Cadence of Hyrule: Crypt of the NecroDancer featuring The Legend of Zelda
extra_info: Fun game, and even though its short I think its the perfect length. Just didn't fund much reason to replay it. 2 playthroughs, including unfinished Octavo run.

title: Card City Nights 2
extra_info: This is not how you make a card battling game, sorry. There is basically only 1 or 2 effects on the cards, and not even those are interesting.

title: Cars 2
extra_info: Another great racing game on the Wii. This game is more focused on fun items and other game-modes than the racing itself, but it's all just good fun.

title: CATS: Crash Arena Turbo Stars
extra_info: Fun little auto-battle game where you build a beefy wooden car and beat other cars.

title: Celeste
extra_info: Best movement in a platformer game ever. 20+ playthroughs, including multiple challenge runs, and speedruns. Only thing missing from 100% is chapter 9 golden berry.

title: Clicker Heroes
extra_info: Quite a good idle game, but it slows down drastically after a while.

title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
extra_info: I have a lot of nostalgia for this game, and I remember having a ton of fun playing it. But in reality it's probably nothing special gameplay-wise, although the theming based on the movie is done very well.

title: Coin Master
extra_info: Gambling but for kids. Playing this with friends was not fun because you always get targeted and lose so much progress you can't get anywhere. The gameplay loop is also so slow and boring.

title: Color Switch
extra_info: Little color-based game with a bunch of different game-modes. The game kinda got ruined when they started removing game-modes, including some of the best ones.

title: Cookie Clicker
extra_info: Really good idle game with so many customizations and different strategies to abuse cookie gain. Biggest problem is golden cookie rng and waiting for sugar lumps. I will achieve 100% around the middle of may 2026.

title: Coromon
extra_info: Cool little pokémon ripoff, but I became bored of it after a while, like I tend to do with pokémon games.

title: Crash Bandicoot: The Wrath of Cortex
extra_info: Crash games are hit or miss for sure, but this one has some fun levels and its generally quite fun. I will however never 100% a crash game because of the stupid speedrun challenges that feel impossible. 2 playthroughs.

title: Crash Nitro Kart
extra_info: A really fun racing game with some insane levels. I was never good at this game since it has a high skill ceiling, but back in the day it was just pure fun anyways.

title: Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled
extra_info: Basically a more skill based version of mario kart, which makes it feel so much more satisfying when you master it. I also love how hard the time trial ghosts are after they added the devs best times.

title: Crazy Dino Park
extra_info: You go on ventures to collect bones to build dinosaurs, then gain money and get more dinos, very cool.

title: Create
extra_info: This was a cool little physics puzzle game, where you had to place objects in the right places to guide something to it's goal. Nowadays this idea is overdone in mobile games, but this was presented in a nice way and worked perfectly for the Wii.

title: Creativerse
extra_info: Definitely the best Minecraft ripoff, but with a bigger focus on building cool things. Certainly wouldn't have been as fun without friends.

title: Cris Tales
extra_info: An RPG with a cool time-traveling gimmick. The art-style is really cute, and the gimmick is used very interestingly both outside and inside of combat.

title: Crush Crush
extra_info: Another idle game but you flirt with multiple girls and learn skills to get more attractive to them. This game however gets super slow after a while, because leveling up skills just takes time.

title: Curve Fever
extra_info: This game is like snake, but you turn in a curve, and it's multiplayer where the last player to crash wins, and theres a bunch of power-ups to sabotage eachother.

title: Cyclomaniacs (1 & 2)
extra_info: A 2D cycling game with a bunch of cool characters. You need to do tricks, wheelies, flips, and more to gain boost to go faster.

title: Cytus
extra_info: This is one of the rhythm games I probably should like, but I didn't click with it. It feels outdated and unsmooth.

title: Dancing Line
extra_info: Classic mobile rhythm game where you simply go left or right to stay on path. The levels also get quite hard which is often uncommon in popular mobile games.

title: Dark Souls
extra_info: Played both the remaster and prepare to die edition. Amazing game, but it has aged poorly and plays a bit janky. 3 playthroughs, including soul level 1 run (all bosses), and straight sword hilt only run (all bosses).

title: Dark Souls 2: Scholar of the First Sin
extra_info: This game has some bad features and ideas, but it's very over-hated. The charm and feeling just makes the game so fun still. 2 playthroughs, including unfinished soul level 1 run.

title: Dark Souls 3
extra_info: Amazing souls like game, only complaint is the linearity. 3 playthroughs, including soul level 1 run, and unfinished broken sword only run.

title: Darwin Project
extra_info: A battle royale game, but very unique in the setting. There are only 10 players, and you are in a snowy area where you can only fight with an axe and a bow. There's also some survival aspects and item crafting that are cool.

title: Dashy Square
extra_info: Geometry Dash ripoff that looked cool, but is in reality just an inferior game that might be fun for an hour or two.

title: Disco Zoo
extra_info: You go on ventures to find animals to put in your zoo. You then gain money from the animals and keep collecting more. Very fun to waste time with, and the art-style is cute.

title: Disgaea 5 Complete
extra_info: I don't think this game is bad at all, but the combat is a bit too deep and hard to understand. I mainly dropped the game because only 1 or 2 of my units were strong, and the rest do basically no damage, so it felt very unbalanced.

title: Disney's Extreme Skate Adventure
extra_info: A tony hawk-like skating game with disney characters across disney universes. It may sound bland on paper, but the gameplay is still very in depth and awesome, as the worlds are more explorable worlds than just basic skate parks. 3 playthroughs.

title: Disney Universe
extra_info: A cute multiplayer game where some guys adventure through Disney movie universes. It reminds me a lot of the feeling of playing older LEGO video games, which is a great compliment.

title: Don't Touch The Spikes
extra_info: A game where you go between spikes as a bird. I mostly just constantly watched ads to upgrade the bird park though.

title: Donkey Kong Country Returns
extra_info: The only donkey kong game I've played, but it's a good one. The best thing about it is the very good theming, but except for a few, the levels can get dull at points. 2 playthroughs.

title: Dragonball Z: Budokai
extra_info: If I had only played this game in single-player, I would hate it, but if you play multiplayer and you embrace the goofiness of it all, this is a fun time.

title: Dragon Mania Legends
extra_info: You raise dragons, breed them, create new species, and use them in battles. Finding new species is fun, and caring for them.

title: Dragon Quest XI S: Echoes of an Elusive Age - Definitive Edition
extra_info: The JRPG of all JRPGs, but in a very good way. A particularly fun game to 100% during online school in 2020. 4 playthroughs, including no shopping run, and unfinished 2D run.

title: Duck Life (1-3)
extra_info: Classic browser game where you train a duck to compete in races. The races are done automatically, but the training process is the fun part.

title: Earn to Die (1 & 2)
extra_info: It's a zombie apocalypse and to escape it you run them over with a car that you upgrade with weapons, pretty cool yeah.

title: Egg, Inc.
extra_info: Collect billions of chickens and gain money to store trillions of chickens! Quite a satisfying idle game as you can see all the chickens running, and you can reach some high numbers.

title: Elden Ring
extra_info: Absolutely love the bosses and exploration. I do like the open world experimentation for the souls genre, but I still prefer the more linear style.

title: Electronic Super Joy
extra_info: Groovy platformer with sick music and vibes. 3 playthroughs.

title: Ender Lilies: Quietus of the Knights
extra_info: Fun metroidvania with a really good art-style. I could however want a few more main bosses instead of the many minibosses. 2 playthroughs.

title: Everybody Edits
extra_info: A cool multiplayer platforming game where you can build levels on a grid and play them with other people. I always remember playing massive parkour levels with fun gimmicks.

title: Excite Truck
extra_info: An awesome racing game with monster trucks. This game really just makes you feel cool as fuck with the sick environments, rad music, and epic visual effects and stunts you can do.

title: Factory Balls (1-4)
extra_info: Cool puzzle game series where you design a ball with a big variety of tools. The puzzles become very complex and difficult in some of the games.

title: Fallout Shelter
extra_info: Let's be honest, we all played this at some point. It's ok, but quite boring after a while.

title: Fire Emblem Heroes
extra_info: Fire Emblem really fits for a mobile game, but the combat is quite simple. I always had auto battle on however, since I only cared about doing gacha for good-looking characters lol. The game has gotten more story chapters since i dropped it, but i had finished the game at that point.

title: Fireboy and Watergirl
extra_info: Classic 2-player puzzle game where you escape a temple together. The puzzles are very interesting, and the story concept is very cute and sad.

title: Fire Emblem: Three Houses
extra_info: Gameplay can become very samey after a while, but the combat is lowkey the games' weakest aspect, the characters makes up for it. 3 playthroughs: Crimson Flower route, Azure Moon route, and Byleth only Silver Snow route.

title: Flakboy (1 & 2)
extra_info: Use landmines, spikes, launchpads, black holes, freezing death machines, and more to deal as much damage to a doll as possible. What's not to like about this.

title: FlatOut (1 & 2)
extra_info: This game series is just the definition of having fun with cars. You drive around with trashy cars and destroy them in various ways, or drive actual races on rally-like tracks. Absolute classic.

title: Forager
extra_info: Very cute little island exploration game. There's a bunch of things to craft and things to do. I got all achievements, but accidentally used my 'literally annihilates anything'-weapon on a puzzle structure that can give you a big chest.

title: Forgive Me Father
extra_info: A completely alright FPS game with a very nice art style. The levels are pretty boring in general and it feels a little repetitive, but the combat and vibe is still quite fun.

title: Fortnite
extra_info: No... just no. I had to try it to see how it was, but it really is not good. All the characters they keep adding are cringe and childish.

title: Garfield's Scary Scavenger Hunt
extra_info: A point & click browser game where you help garfield escape a spooky mansion. I remember I got stuck at some part because I couldn't figure it out, but there were some nice puzzles.

title: Genshin Impact
extra_info: The game looks very good and has some in depth combat, but I didn't want to play it on mobile so I waited until it came to the switch, which never happened.

title: Geometry Dash
extra_info: This game will forever be a classic, and you cannot dismiss it just for being a 1 button game. Don't have 100% completion anymore since they just added hundreds of achievements.

title: Geometry Dash (Meltdown & SubZero & World)
extra_info: Some geometry dash spin-offs to promote new updates. They are all quite decent, but there is no reason to return to these games except for nostalgia.

title: Give Up (1 & 2)
extra_info: In these games you play through the same room which gets progressively more difficult with a lot of lasers, spikes, and obstacles. I beat both games in about an hour each.

title: Good Knight
extra_info: A one button bullet hell game, just the idea got me interested, and the visuals are really cool at that. All in all, the gameplay is good but repetitive, especially since the levels are too long.

title: Gravitee Wars
extra_info: A game where there is a bunch of planets with characters split into teams. Your characters shoot missiles effected by the gravity pulls of the planets to eliminate all other characters. It's like the worms games but with funky gravity.

title: GrindCraft
extra_info: A Minecraft inspired game where you craft a ton of stuff until you have basically built an entire city with boats and everything.

title: Grow (Island & Tower)
extra_info: These are some very short games where you simply choose between a few options, and different things happen depending on the order, and only one order leads to completion.

title: Happy Wheels
extra_info: Such a fun game with so many different things you can do because of the great level editor and all the different characters. Simply so much fun.

title: Have a Nice Death
extra_info: I want to like this game a lot because of the awesome art-style, but I haven't been able to get into it yet, probably because i'm not that into rogue-likes.

title: Hay Day
extra_info: An absolute classic farming game. The progression is very good and always being able to design your farm in many ways.

title: Hearthstone (Battlegrounds)
extra_info: The battleground game-mode is a very fun auto-battler between 8 players, and there are many different builds to make. The updates were very fun with the new additions always switching it up. The game sadly started becoming too laggy however, and it crashes mid-game a lot, at least on mobile.

title: Head Basketball
extra_info: Very fun basketball game with fun characters and different game-modes. Playing this on long car rides was very special.

title: Hedgehog Launch (1 & 2)
extra_info: Funny game where you launch a hedgehog as high as possible, while you collect money in the air and bounce on platforms.

title: Hill Climb Racing
extra_info: Classic mobile racing game with different vehicles, courses, and upgrading. The gameplay just gets a bit repetitive when you find the best coin grinding strategies.

title: Hill Climb Racing 2
extra_info: Random follow-up to the classic game. This one is very different as it's focused on online races instead, but it's still an alright game. Just doesn't have the same longevity.

title: Hob: The Definitive Edition
extra_info: This game is the definition of great world-building. Very cute and good art-style as well. 2 playthroughs. I was literally 5 minutes away from 100%ing the game, but I was stupid and my savefile broke.

title: Hollow Knight
extra_info: The (former) best metroidvania game, with an amazing world and art direction. I can barely point out any flaws about it. 10+ playthroughs, including dashless run, geoless run, and randomizer run. All radiant bosses completed.

title: Hollow Knight: Silksong
extra_info: How they managed to improve on the first game amazes me. The movement is better, the world feels even more lively, and the characters and their quests are great. The difficulty can feel off at times since way too many enemies deal double damage. 3 playthroughs, including unfinished dashless run.

title: Holy Potatoes! We're in Space?!
extra_info: Of course I bought this because potatoes are in space, I mean... how could I not. But the gameplay just wasn't it for me at all.

title: Honkai Impact 3rd
extra_info: A better version of Genshin Impact. The combat is more interesting and the story is very impacting. But I got too addicted to the events and side things so I never beat the story mode.

title: Hot Wheels: Track Attack
extra_info: A racing game using hot wheels cars. It's a cool and fun game, but nothing too special about it.

title: Iconoclasts
extra_info: I really love this game. The characters are nice and the bosses are cool. The art-style is also nice and the characters have funny animations. RIP to the soundtrack on spotify. 3 playthroughs, all being 100% completed.

title: Idle Dice
extra_info: An idle game where you throw dice, and get score depending of the dice, similar to poker. The game gets very slow quite quickly though.

title: Idle Heroes
extra_info: I really don't remember much about this game, but as it's an auto-battler where you get new gear and beat levels, it was definitely quite fun.

title: Idle Mine
extra_info: A little idle game where you mine different ores and they get stronger, so you have to upgrade your pickaxe. It doesn't get slow as fast as most other idle games do.

title: Idle Planet Miner
extra_info: One of the slowest idle games I have played. Throughout 25 hours I was able to ascend only once, and even that barely gave a boost in game speed. At least the gathering and crafting system is done well.

title: Ingression
extra_info: A cute precision platformer with a cool portal gimmick. It feels quite similar to celeste with a different mood.

title: Into Space (1-3)
extra_info: These games (especially the second) are really fun and I played them a lot. You launch a rocket up and try to steer it away from obstacles in the way, and try to get as high as possible. You then take the gains and upgrade your rocket. It feels like Learn to Fly, but with more going on during the actual rounds.

title: Island Xtreme Stunts
extra_info: Funny little lego game where you do random stuff on an island. I remember delivering pizza on a skateboard and it was so damn sick.

title: Ittle Dew
extra_info: I played this mainly to see how the original was after having enjoyed the sequel a lot. This game is very bare-bones, but has some lovely ideas, and brings replayability through the achievements.

title: Ittle Dew 2+
extra_info: This game is so amazing. Incredibly cute and charming, super creative puzzles, very replayable, and bunch of secrets. The combat can even resemble a souls-like at points. 10+ playthroughs, including 2 frogmode runs, and some speedruns.

title: Itorah
extra_info: Metroidvania with a cool little staff. Very basic, but the artstyle and characters are pretty nice looking.

title: Jetpack Joyride
extra_info: Another classic mobile game where you fly as far as possible, and it actually gets difficult after a while. It's also fun to gain coins and upgrade your equipment for the next runs.

title: Just Dance (2-4 & 2014)
extra_info: I grew up on the Just Dance games and they were always a lot of fun. I naturally grew out of them, but it's still THE best workout game since it was so fun at the same time.

title: Just Shapes & Beats
extra_info: Love the idea and execution of this game, the story and characters are cute. I just kinda wish the gameplay had some different styles to it, kinda like how Undertale does during combat.

title: Kamikaze Pigs
extra_info: A bunch of pigs are riding around in military planes and vehicles. You get to shoot a few of them to start a chain reaction which kills as many pigs as possible. Going for all the stars in this game is super hard I remember.

title: Karlsson på taket och Kuckelimuckmedicinen
extra_info: Another swedish childrens game that was always really fun. I have great memories playing this after school with other kids, stealing meatballs and cinnamon buns from grandma in the game.

title: Kapsyljakt med Anki & Pytte
extra_info: A Childhood game about a duck goofing around. This game has increadible charm and it was so fun as a child.

title: King of Thieves
extra_info: Creating your own dungeon and invading others is a fun idea. The gameplay just becomes repetitive, and the gem stealing odds are so low, nothing ever happens.

title: Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe
extra_info: Played through the whole game in one day at a friends house. It's a very good multiplayer game, but I don't think I would play it alone too much.

title: Knightmare Tower
extra_info: You are a knight who climbs a tower to save some princesses, but instead of being a platformer, this game launches you up the tower, followed by enemies and lava. You have to upgrade your items to get further up the tower in a very fun gameplay loop.

title: Knights & Dragons
extra_info: Very fun auto-battling game where you craft the better armor and equipment, then go out an slay waves of enemies or event bosses. Being in a quild and doing all the events was very fun.

title: Lanota
extra_info: A super fun and unique rhythm game. The songs are all so different, and the circle playfield is used in very clever ways.

title: Learn to Fly
extra_info: A fun game where you make a penguin fly as far as possible. As the first game in the series, this one was not established as well as the others, and simply lacks features. 2 playthroughs.

title: Learn to Fly 2
extra_info: This is a perfect sequel to the original game, expanding upon the main idea, adding more things to do and more items to purchase, more customizability. All the achievements also makes it very fun to play through in multiple ways. 5+ playthroughs.

title: Learn to Fly 3
extra_info: This game is a perfect way to continue the series, where they switched up the idea completely, as making the game too similar as the last one would have been weird. But this game still executes on its new ideas and has so much content to go through, and I never even got some of the last achievements. 5+ playthroughs.

title: Learn to Fly Idle
extra_info: A sweet little idle game based on the learn to fly series. It's cute and has a unique theming, but the gameplay is like most other idle games, except there is only one goal and no ascensions.

title: LEGO Batman: The Videogame
extra_info: The early lego games were amazing, and lego batman is no exception. The levels are really fun and well made, the bosses were cool, and there was just so much to do.

title: LEGO Indiana Jones 2: The Adventure Continues
extra_info: Another incredible lego game, and I played through it years after and it still holds up. The levels are well constructed and there's many fun gimmicks that can be done with indiana jones. 2 playthroughs.

title: LEGO Racers
extra_info: I have very fond memories of bringing this game to play after school, and I was always the best at it there. The tracks were quite interesting and fun for being such an old game.

title: LEGO Racers 2
extra_info: Basically the open world version of Lego Racers, and it definitely worked well. I lost the game cartridge at some point so I never finished it.

title: LEGO Star Wars 2: The Original Trilogy
extra_info: Just like most early lego games, this one is super fun. The levels are so well constructed, and you can enjoy it all without knowing anything about star wars.

title: Lies of P
extra_info: Very fun soulslike game. The parrying system and the setting makes the game different enough to feel refreshing. The only problem is how linear it is, even more so than Dark Souls 3. Only missing one dumb achievement for 100%.

title: Lonely Mountains: Downhill
extra_info: Really fun racing game, with amazing speedrun content. At the time I was a top 5 speedrunner in the game, and finding new shortcuts was very fun.

title: Make More
extra_info: A very average idle game where you hire people to work in a factory to make products.

title: Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle
extra_info: This has to be one of the most underrated mario games ever. The combat is really fun and diverse, the characters are funny, and the bosses are really good. I also love how the arenas are tied into the world, unlike in the sequel. 3 playthroughs. I have also 99%ed the DLC, since the last challenges are super hard.

title: Mario + Rabbids Sparks of Hope
extra_info: I was excited for this since I loved the first game, but I think it lost all its charm. The combat just feels way less fun, and I miss that the arenas are tied into the explorable map.

title: Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games (Original & Winter & London 2012)
extra_info: These games were tons of fun, with some creative minigames all over, including the dream variants which were insane. I remember the Olympic winter games to be my favorite in the series.

title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe
extra_info: Very solid Mario Kart game with a great variety of tracks, along with banger music as always.

title: Mario Kart Double Dash!!
extra_info: The goofiest of the mario kart games for sure. Driving wise, this one isn't the most special, but if you just want some pure fun and chaos, this is the one.

title: Mario Kart Tour
extra_info: The idea to make a mario kart game for mobile is so good, but they absolutely fumbled it by making the game in vertical mode, and making the drifting system so simple. It does not feel like a mario kart game, and that's the problem.

title: Mario Kart Wii
extra_info: This is easily the best mario kart game by having actual good inside drift, amazing tracks and music, and endless replayability. I'm just sad I never got any mods for the game to work, since the modding scene is huge and would easily make it a 10/10 game.

title: Mario Party (4-6)
extra_info: The mario party games on the gamecube are the peak of the series. They include the best concepts, minigames, and boards. I especially love Mario Party 6 with the day and night concept.

title: Mario Party 8
extra_info: This is the last Mario Party game I played, and it is different but still the same fun. I especially enjoyed the board where you capture hotels and grow them, as it reminds me of Pac-Man Party.

title: Mekazoo
extra_info: Cool platformer with some robot animals and stuff. Can't say much about it, it's just decent.

title: Minecraft
extra_info: I mean... it's Minecraft. It might just be the most perfect videogame ever, from singleplayer worlds, to servers like Mineplex, to the amazing mods available. I still don't think I have actually beat the ender dragon in survival though. My playtime may be very wrong since there is no good way to track it.

title: Mmm Fingers (1 & 2)
extra_info: This is basically the opposite of Fruit Ninja. You hold your finger and avoid auto-scrolling obstacles and get as far as possible. Sometimes the game thinks you released your finger, which can ruin the experience completely.

title: Monster Hunter Rise
extra_info: This game made me realize that I don't enjoy fighting big enemies in games. The monsters also have too much health, and the gameplay becomes very samey even if the monsters have great variety. Still a pretty fun game.

title: Moonlighter
extra_info: A binding of isaac type game with a nice artstyle, but you collect items that you sell in your shop. The game can feel a little clunky movement-wise, and having to find very specific items can suck.

title: Muse Dash
extra_info: This game is basically just Taiko but waaaaay more visually insane and anime, love it.

title: Mushroom Madness (1-3)
extra_info: A cute game series where you protect your mushrooms by killing animals trying to eat them by using several weapons.

title: MyBrute
extra_info: This game is a unique browser game where you make a character who auto battles against other players character. When you level up, your character gets a random stat, weapon, or animal to help in battle. You can only fight an amount of times per day, so this game wokred as a fun game to play once a day.

title: My Little Pony: Magic Princess
extra_info: Don't count this game out just because it's for the bronies. It's a bit like Hay Day, but you get new ponies, you play with them, decorate the areas, and play a lot of fun minigames. 2 playthroughs.

title: Myror I Brallan
extra_info: A fun little childrens game about nature, including a bunch of minigames, some being educational or just fun.

title: Need for Speed: Most Wanted
extra_info: Need for Speed games are always awesome. It's always fun to have as many cops as possible on your tail as possible and try to get rid of them. The actual normal races are lowkey the weakest part of the game, but still good since the blacklist concept is fun and motivating.

title: Need for Speed: Underground
extra_info: Maybe the best NFS game, solely for the very moody and dark graphics making it feel like you are illegally racing in the streets at night.

title: New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe
extra_info: I thought I would enjoy this a lot more since I loved the game on Wii, but this game was almost a slog to get through. On both the main game and Luigi U, I did everything but getting the 5th star, and I also have a few uncompleted challenges.

title: New Super Mario Bros. Wii
extra_info: This is the perfect 2D mario game. Every single level is memorable and fun to play. The multiplayer aspect makes everything better. Just the perfect game to chill out to. The only thing that I would do is improve most of the bosses, but they are at least better than in the other 2D mario games. 5+ playthroughs.

title: Osu!
extra_info: Very fun and addicting rhythm game, there is really no game like it. Only problem is how this game gave me wrist issues at one point so I had to stop playing it for a while.

title: Pac-Man Party
extra_info: Basically just like Mario Party games, but instead of collecting stars, you build mansions at multiple places around the board, and level them up when you pass them again. You can also steal other players mansions by fighting them in minigames. I generally like this gameplay loop more than Mario Party.

title: Paladins
extra_info: The game is not available on Switch anymore, but I did play a little before, and it was decent.

title: Paladog
extra_info: A 2D warrior game where a paladin-dog escorts allies and uses abilities to defeat the enemies and reach their base. I remember really enjoying it, but it had a lot of levels.

title: Phigros
extra_info: One of the most fun rhythm games simply for the great songs and how insane the maps look. The developers have full control of the map editor and they really use it to make the craziest maps, and they are so fun because of it.

title: Piano Tiles 2
extra_info: Not that special of a game, but I always liked unlocking Flight of the Bumblebee and showing off my skill to classmates during schoolbreaks.

title: PickCrafter
extra_info: One of the most fun clicker games, and it's based on Minecraft. You break blocks and use them to craft new pickaxes and unlock new worlds. 3 playthroughs.

title: Pixels Filling Squares 3.0
extra_info: A cool little idle game where you watch squares get filled up by pixels. It's fun for quite a long time, especially doing the challenges, but about 80% into the game it becomes way too slow.

title: Platform Racing 2
extra_info: This game was an absolute classic. You run through a level and try to get to the finish first while using overpowered powerups and jamming to awesome music.

title: Pokémon GO
extra_info: This game was an interesting twist for the series, but it works so extremely well. It was a great way to motivate people to go outside, and most people didn't mind at all since the game was just fun and addicting. Even my dad played this a lot and got to level 39.

title: Pokémon Quest
extra_info: I think this game is underrated, but it is mostly a mobile game so its just alright. Only problem is when you get stuck, it's hard to progress anywhere.

title: Pokémon Sword
extra_info: Not the biggest Pokémon fan, but I did enjoy this game a bit. I would have preferred if the wild area was smaller and multiple instead of just one big thing.

title: Pokémon: Let's Go, Pikachu!
extra_info: I don't remember too much of this game, but I know it was pretty fun. No I don't like Pikachu more than Eevee, I don't know why I played this version.

title: Pokémon: Magikarp Jump
extra_info: Cute little game where you train a magikarp to jump high, and then enter into a championship. The gameplay loop is repetitive, but that's more so intentional.

title: Postal: Brain Damaged
extra_info: Very refreshing FPS singleplayer game carried by the humor in weapons, enemies, the world, and stupid story. I love it.

title: Pou
extra_info: You take care of your pou, dress it up, and have fun. But the fun part is the wide variety of minigames with the pou theming.

title: Power Painter
extra_info: A tower defense game where you merge the towers to level them up. The game got ruined when I found an exploit that allows one tower to one-shot anything

title: Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku
extra_info: A rhythm game with cute characters and good story. The gameplay is fun but simple. The game started lagging a bit too much after a while which is just not acceptable for a rhythm game like this.

title: Rayman Arena
extra_info: A very fun running racing game with some rayman characters. I have great nostalgia for this game, and the levels are very well made. Even the battle gamemode was tons of fun.

title: Rayman Raving Rabbids: TV Party
extra_info: A funny multiplayer game where you have to do a certain task in a short time, similar to warioware games. What makes it special is the humor from the fact the rabbids are stupid as shit.

title: Red Ball
extra_info: Another classic browser platforming game. It's short and sweet, with some nicely designed levels.

title: Red Remover
extra_info: A little game where you have to remove all the red blocks from the screen, while keeping all green blocks on screen. It uses gravity and more to create some interesting puzzle levels.

title: Relicta
extra_info: I played this since it looked similar to The Talos Principle. The progression is too linear, and it doesn't have that many puzzle features, but the ones it has are executed on very in depth.

title: Rider
extra_info: A simple 2D infinite racing game. It really just feel like Bike Race but with a different asthetic and no end to the levels.

title: Rio
extra_info: A collection of Mario Party type minigames but based on the movie Rio. Some of the minigames were fun, but the replay value isn't that big.

title: River City Girls
extra_info: I'm not into this genre, but I played this with a friend so it was still fun. The game has a lot of charm with the different attacks, characters, and enemies.

title: River City Girls 2
extra_info: This essentially just feels like the first game, but a little bigger, and the bosses are more unique. Also played this game with a friend.

title: Roblox
extra_info: I basically only play EToH on here. The enjoyment of Roblox fully depends on what games you find, and how toxic the playerbase is.

title: Rocket League
extra_info: Really good game concept, and it is executed very well. I personally just think the stages should be more varied in shape and gameplay, as it can get a bit stale after a while. I for example really enjoyed the hockey gamemode and the disappearing floor goal gamemode.

title: Rolling Sky
extra_info: Quite a fun game where you roll a ball through a level. The obstacles are fun and the levels are varied.

title: Run (1-3)
extra_info: Classic browser game where you run through levels with less and less floor available. It uses 3D in a very creative way for its time, and it makes the gameplay really addicting.

title: SCGMD4
extra_info: This is simply an amazing Guitar Hero rip-off. The songs are good, it has cool guitars and boss fights, the achievements are really fun to grind for, and trying to get perfecto on all songs. But I was never good enough to get perfecto on about 4 songs. 5+ playthroughs.

title: Scrap Clicker 2
extra_info: A fun idle game where you merge trashcans and gain more money from them, upgrade to get better trashcans, and repeat. But it is very fun and has a lot of new unlocks throughout. 2 playthroughs.

title: Shopping Cart Hero (1-3)
extra_info: A funny game series where you run down a hill and hop into a shopping cart and fly as far as possible. There's a lot of fun upgrades you can buy, and eventually doing tricks in the air and buying family members makes the gameplay much more interesting and gives a sense of risk.

title: Serious Sam HD: The First Encounter
extra_info: Classic fps game I have a lot of nostalgia for, and it still holds up well. 5 playthroughs, including serious run, all secrets run, and serious no secrets run.

title: Serious Sam HD: The Second Encounter
extra_info: Another classic Serious Sam game, but now with more open areas. 5 playthroughs, including serious run, all secrets run, and serious no secrets run.

title: Serious Sam 2
extra_info: A bit dated, but it has its own charm. The dual wielding update honestly just made the game better. 3 playthroughs, including serious run, and all secrets run.

title: Serious Sam 3: BFE
extra_info: At some points I want to absolutely love this game, but then I get to one of the cave sections. 4 playthroughs, including serious run, and all secrets run.

title: Serious Sam 4
extra_info: Love the massive fields and side quests added in this entry in the series, and it easily has the best combat. 3 playthroughs, including serious run, and all secrets and side quests run.

title: Serious Sam: Siberian Mayhem
extra_info: Really just Serious Sam 4 but shorter and with a snow theme, and I love snow. 3 playthroughs, including serious run, and all secrets and side quests run.

title: SEUM: Speedrunners from Hell
extra_info: Nice speedrunning game, but the leaderboards are ruined due to updates patching bugs. Never got 100% due to needing to have a steam friend who owns the game lol.

title: Shin Megami Tensei V
extra_info: Played the original on the switch, and bought the vengeance version for PC. 4 playthroughs, including unfinished damageless run, and unfinished vengeance run.

title: Slime Village
extra_info: Collect a bunch of slimes and send them out to defeat bosses, then upgrade the slimes. It's a simple game but it's cute at least.

title: Sling Kong
extra_info: A cool concept for a game, and the physics are fun to just sling around animals. The daily challenge where you complete a level as fast as possible is alot more fun than the main mode where you survive infinitely.

title: Slope
extra_info: A game that for some reason everyone loved to play during classes back in 2018 or so. The game is poorly made and has an incredible amount of bugs and horrible collision, but it was a slightly fun moment in time.

title: Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing
extra_info: Another fantastic racing game on the Wii. A wide variety of characters, fun levels, great music, and a mission mode.

title: Sonic Adventure 2: Battle
extra_info: The first level of this game may be the only one I remember, but wow is it amazing. Most of the time I spent in this game was on chao racing, because damn they are cute.

title: Sonic Colors
extra_info: I normally don't like Sonic games too much, but this one has an interesting vibe to it. I also enjoy the abilities the little ghost guys give you, allowing for some more non-traditional Sonic gameplay.

title: Sonic Generations
extra_info: Decent sonic game, but I didn't find the while old and new sonic gimmick to be anything special. I had no real reason to drop the game, it's still an alright game.

title: Sonic Riders
extra_info: Very sick racing game where the class of the character you pick can take different routes on each track. Some can break walls, other can fly, and others can grind rails. The feeling of this game feels just right, and has some great music along with it.

title: Sort the Court!
extra_info: Cute little game where you are the king, and either accept or decline your peoples requests. It is surprisingly interesting, and some of the requests can lead to massive stakes or positives. 2 playthroughs.

title: Soundodger+
extra_info: Music focused bullet hell game with mouse movement. It's a very cool idea, but gets quite boring quickly.

title: Splasher
extra_info: Fast-moving platformer with colors and bouncing around. I love that there is a speedrunning mode since that fits so well for the game.

title: Splatoon 2
extra_info: I love this game so much. Not a game genre I usually enjoy, but it is done so creatively and playfully here. There's also many different gamemodes and all of them are very good. Even the 2 story modes are really good. Shoutouts to Squid beatz 2. I have 100%ed both story modes.

title: Splatoon 3
extra_info: Probably objectively better than Splatoon 2, but some of the maps in this game kinda suck. They also removed Squid beatz 2. 100% in both story modes, but I don't have all weapons or gear.

title: Spyro: A Hero's Tail
extra_info: I enjoy this game alot more than Enter the Dragonfly, as this one has more variety in its gameplay and has more memorable characters. Not sure why I never finished it however.

title: Spyro: Enter the Dragonfly
extra_info: This spyro game fells pretty basic with its level design and gameplay loop. It feels like you are doing almost the same thing over again for each world, even if you aren't. 2 playthroughs.

title: Stardew Valley
extra_info: Best farming game, with good characters and exploration. 4 playthroughs, including 100%, and staminaless (all bundles).

title: Stories: The Path of Destinies
extra_info: Played this since it was free for a limited time, and got a friend to play it along with. It's nothing special, but has some decent combat. Don't have 100% because the game got repetitive and I don't want to figure out what routes I haven't done.

title: Subway Surfers
extra_info: A classic infinite runner with cool seasonal characters and themes. The game is just a bit too easy, never gets hard, and you can just spam hoverboards.

title: SuicIDLE
extra_info: An interesting idle game where you help a loser to commit suicide multiple times. For being an idle game, the story is pretty funny, and is what drives you to continue.

title: Super Crazy Guitar Maniac Deluxe (2 & 3)
extra_info: A couple of Guitar Hero rip-offs just like SCGDM4, but these two were made by a different person. The gameplay and songs are good, but simply worse than their successor, as well as these games not having bosses or achievements.

title: Super Duck Punch!
extra_info: This is a funny fighting game where you box animals in unfair quantities. Some of the fights are extremely hard, like fighting 10 hydras at once.

title: Super Mario 3D World
extra_info: I was excited to play this ever since the Wii U, but it was disappointing. The levels are unique and all, but I just didn't find it fun or engaging for whatever reason. Bowser's Fury is better than the main game. 99% because I will never beat all levels with all characters for the last 5 stamps.

title: Super Mario 63
extra_info: A sweet little 2D game based on Mario 64, but it has its own personality and ideas.

title: Super Mario 64
extra_info: Controls and camera are janky, and some stars are very confusing. I Personally don't think the game is that good nowadays, people just have nostalgia for it. But it still has a lot of charm to it, and it was revolutionary at the time.

title: Super Mario Bros. (1 & 3)
extra_info: Classic games they may be, but these games don't hold up today personally, and I couldn't force myself to finish playing through them every time I have tried.

title: Super Mario Galaxy
extra_info: This game has amazing ideas and executes on them well, but you will never convince me it's better than the sequel. And I will never 100% it because of Luigi mode. 3 playthroughs throughout the years.

title: Super Mario Galaxy 2
extra_info: This is the best Mario game ever. It takes the concepts of the first game and improves upon them in every way. Incredible music, better galaxies, better bosses, better level progression, and way better post-game. 5+ playthroughs.

title: Super Mario Maker 2
extra_info: Incredible game idea, and i'm still surprised Nintendo did it. I just didn't enjoy it as much as I expected to. Also they ruined 100 mario challenge.

title: Super Mario Odyssey
extra_info: Still an amazing mario game to this day, and by far the mario game with the best movement. It always feels so replayable even if you know where all moons are. 10+ playthroughs, including 3 100% runs, and no coins max moons run.

title: Super Mario RPG
extra_info: Nice experimentation into RPGs for mario games, also has some good humor. But the main issue is the balancing, which makes fights either super easy or weirdly hard, ruining most of the experience.

title: Super Mario Sunshine
extra_info: Extremely fun and well-aged mario game with great ideas. 3 playthroughs throughout the years.

title: Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island
extra_info: I know this game is great, but playing it myself so many years after it came out, I was never able to get myself to play through it all.

title: Super Monkey Ball
extra_info: This is the perfect arcade-like pure enjoyment game. Rolling around as a monkey in a ball, launching off ledges and bouncing around, is extremely fun. The levels are also perfectly designed for this type of physics. All the other gamemodes are also a blast.

title: Super Monkey Ball Banana Blitz
extra_info: This monkey ball game is good gameplay wise, but it feels almost too modern, and removes alot of the charm that is found from the earlier games wacky level design. It also has weird boss fights I don't know how to feel about.

title: Super One More Jump
extra_info: Cool little Geometry Dash type game but with interesting gravity flips. The second to last level is awful and is stopping me from 100%ing the game.

title: Super Paper Mario
extra_info: Another game that I absolutely love in concept, but some of the puzzles and level designs make it confusing to know where to go and what to do.

title: Super Smash Bros. Brawl
extra_info: Despite not being the best game in the series, this one is the most fun one, as the levels, items, and physics are wacky and fun. I never cared for the story mode, but playing normal fights with siblings and friends is some of the most fun you can have.

title: Super Smash Bros. Melee
extra_info: This is a community favorite in the series, but I personally feel like it is nothing special. The other games does everything this one does but better, although I can't speak for the story mode that I never played.

title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
extra_info: Used to play this game weekly with my brother for about a year, great fun. 2 story mode playthroughs, including unfinished spiritless easy run.

title: Super Stacker 2
extra_info: A game where you get to place blocks in a certain order, and the goal is to make them not fall over in the end. Some puzzles have interesting ideas and play with the physics engine.

title: Survivor.io
extra_info: A simple Vampire Survivors rip-off where you survive waves of enemies for 20 minutes while you get to pick different upgrades.

title: Swords and Sandals 3: Gladiae Ultratus
extra_info: A unique 2D turn-based fighting game, where you want to become the best warrior. You upgrade your character with armor and new weapons or spells, then fight a bunch of guys until you can kill the next gladiator, until you get to the top.

title: Swords and Souls
extra_info: You fight battles in an arena, but to get stronger you have to train in different areas to get better. You can also buy new armor and weapons, and use spells during combat. 3 playthroughs.

title: Tap Tap Dash
extra_info: A fun little game where you turn and jump by tapping at the right time, through a ton of short levels. 2 playthroughs.

title: Team Fortress 2
extra_info: I don't usually play this type of games, but this was and is still peak. Just relentless fun on any map and character, and with all the customizable weapons.

title: Territory War
extra_info: A war between stickmen, and they use grenades and assault rifles. It is quite similar to the worms games, but way more simple.

title: Tetris Party Deluxe
extra_info: A fun tetris game with many different gamemodes, like guiding a piece through a puzzle, building shapes with tetris pieces, building a tower for a stick figure, and more.

title: The Battle of Polytopia
extra_info: A cool little grid battler where you start with a small town, you explore to find other cities, farm and forage to upgrade cities, and create more warriors to fight with. Its a great game to play with friends for sure.

title: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth
extra_info: Basically the only rogue-like i manage to enjoy a lot. Only thing left until 100% is 1 challenge, ~10 completions marks, ~15 items, and ~5 other secrets.

title: The End is Nigh
extra_info: Quite a fun platformer with a really good design and setting. 3 playthroughs. Missing 8 deathless carts for 100%.

title: The Escapists 2
extra_info: Quite a fun idea for a game, and it executes on it well. The endgame of jails however just becomes checking desks all day and praying for good items.

title: The Fancy Pants Adventures
extra_info: A cool platformer game with a guy wearing super fancy pants. The artstyle is very nice and the mechanics makes the game stick out.

title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
extra_info: Such a good start to the switches' lifespan. I didn't even plan to buy this, but it is such an amazing game in every way. 4 playthroughs. I never got 100% because the master sword trials were too hard, and I didn't wanna get all the koroks.

title: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
extra_info: Incredible open world exploration, story, and bosses. Demon king? Secret stone?. 3 playthroughs, including ultrahandless run (all shrines), and unfinished depths only run.

title: The Perfect Tower
extra_info: A very fun tower defense game, but you are a tower who defends themself from attacking cubes. There's not many games like it, and the gameplay loop of getting stronger and surviving longer is satisfying. 2 playthroughs.

title: The Pillar: Puzzle Escape
extra_info: Short and sweet The Witness ripoff. It doesn't perform the best, and my savefile bugged sometimes, but the puzzles are good and feel somewhat true to the games glaring inspiration. 2 playthroughs.

title: The Talos Principle
extra_info: Absolutely amazing puzzle experience with such fun puzzle gimmicks and ideas. 5+ playthroughs, including difficult custom maps.

title: The Talos Principle 2
extra_info: The puzzles are still just as good as the original, but the game is too story focused, there are less puzzles, and the stars are less creative to collect.

title: The Tower
extra_info: A reverse tower defense game where you control and upgrade a tower being attacked by enemies. This is just a worse and much much slower version of The Perfect Tower, but there is no better alternative on mobile.

title: The Witness
extra_info: Fun puzzle game with good board ideas and interactions with the world. The biggest problem is that if you can't figure out one puzzle, you need to look it up or you can't beat the game.

title: Theme Park World
extra_info: Great themepark building game, but with a lot of charm due to the rides and attractions having funny designs and goofy characters. Building the craziest rollercoasters and then going backrupt was awesome.

title: This is the Only Level
extra_info: Often referred to as the elefant game, in this game you have to complete a single room, but each time the room has a special gimmick you have to figure out to escape.

title: Toribash
extra_info: Super cool idea for a game, but it is just incredibly slow and boring. This is one of those games you just watch pro player clips of instead of playing.

title: Toss the Turtle
extra_info: A funny game where you toss a turtle using various launchers, and then you shoot the turtle mid-air to make him go further. There are also several hazards along the way to kill you. You then upgrade your items, guns, launchers, and just get frther each time.

title: Township
extra_info: A game very similar to Hay Day, but you build a city instead. The gameplay is just as fun, and it's satisfying to build your own city and upgrade buildings.

title: Toy Story 3
extra_info: I don't remember this game too vividly, but I do remember it having some fun sections and action moments.

title: Trackmania (2020)
extra_info: This game has the best version of the stadium car by far, but the free version of the game basically offers nothing anymore after some updates.

title: Trackmania 2 Canyon
extra_info: Very fun Trackmania game, and my favorite car in Trackmania 2. I never really played the campaign, but instead played and created a lot of tracks with my brother where we competed with each other.

title: Trackmania 2 Stadium
extra_info: Same as Trackmania 2 Canyon, I played this and made tracks with my brother. I've just never been the biggest fan of the stadium car.

title: Trackmania Nations Forever
extra_info: Nothing beats playing this during school, and since its free you can easily compete with friends. 5 campaign playthroughs. Never got 100% Author medals due to not wanting to play E05.

title: Trackmania Turbo
extra_info: Very unique vibe for a Trackmania game, but it works and gives you good motivation to play. I wish I had continued playing this becuase the canyon tracks were very fun, but I got stuck on a valley track with a stupid author medal.

title: Trackmania Wii
extra_info: The Trackmania game that I grew up on. I always remember me and my brothers building a bunch of maps and racing on with eachother. With this game also having 6 environments, it adds may more replay value. I alos came back to this game later on and beat a bunch of world records on the main levels.

title: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger
extra_info: You play as a tasmanian tiger where you either bite enemies or shoot them with boomerangs, what's not to love. The levels are all very good and memorable, with some cool but confusing boss fights. 3 playthroughs.

title: Ty the Tasmanian Tiger 2: Bush Rescue
extra_info: I like the hub world in this game, and the new idea of driving a car to each of the levels seems fun, but the levels themselves are much weaker than in the first game. They are more linear and mostly have one goal, while in the first game the levels feel like mario 64 stages with many goals. 3 playthroughs.

title: Undertale
extra_info: Undertale is a classic of course, very cool game. I myself just got lost somewhere in an area with a bunch of elevators and gave up, was probably my fault though.

title: Uphill Rush (1-6)
extra_info: This is a collection of games where you complete levels while riding waterslides, riding vehicles, and any other random things. It was goofy back then, and it's goofy still.

title: Warframe
extra_info: Quite a cool game. I for some reason just didn't decide to stick around with it, even after 2 attempts on different consoles.

title: Wario Land: Shake It!
extra_info: A funny wario game where you run around and shake a bunch of things to get rich. I don't remember it too well since I lost the game at one point, but it was a fun time.

title: Watch Dogs 2
extra_info: This is just GTA 5 but cooler and more fun. The hacking concept and the story along with it works really well. It also has a good mix of stealth, gun fights, puzzles, and fun side missions. 2 playthroughs.

title: When he jump, he go up like this
extra_info: Quite a funny game where he jump, and he go up like this. An idle game where a stickman jumps so high he breaks through the roof, or even several roofs. I lost my savefile for some reason, but the game got extremely slow at the point I was at anyways.

title: Wii Party
extra_info: This is the game Mario party always wanted to be. There are more gamemodes and cool ideas, like the classic island board game, or the gambling casino mode. And even the minigames are more fun than most mario party minigames.

title: Wii Sports Resort
extra_info: The game that defined Wii gaming. A bunch of classic games like sword fencing, table tennis, bowling, golf, and archery. Even the airplane game was very calming and maybe the one I played the most.

title: WizardChess
extra_info: Cool little chess game in a roguelike style, which is a sick idea. Problem is just that each run is similar to each other, and you always end up with one strong piece that can sweep everything.

title: Worms Battle Island
extra_info: A game where a bunch of worms assert dominance by murdering eachother on an island. The gameplay ideas are very interesting and thought out, making for some good strategies and playstyles.

title: Xenoblade Chronicles: Definitive Edition
extra_info: Incredible game with peak story, world, music, and characters. My only gripes are that the combat is lacking compared to the rest of the series, there's too many quests, and the story locks about 30% of the explorable areas. 3 playthroughs. I don't have 100% due to 11 simply boring achievements. I have 100%ed the DLC though.

title: Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition
extra_info: Very awesome idea to bring the series into open world. But the combat is generally just a little bit better than that of Xenoblade 1, and having to revive your skells manually is wack. The post-game is also quite weak as you can just one-shot any enemy pretty easily.

title: Xenoblade Chronicles 2
extra_info: Flawless world, story, music, characters, side quests, combat, bosses, and even antagonists. The game has some flaws, but no game will be closer to perfect than this for me. 5+ playthroughs, including 1 party member run, and max level before leaving gormott run. I have also 100%ed the DLC.

title: Xenoblade Chronicles 3
extra_info: Amazing world, story, characters, and music. I just don't like any of the antagonists, which the other games in the series nail. 3 playthroughs, including only D rank classes run. I have 100%ed the DLC aswell.

title: Ys VIII: Lacrimosa of Dana
extra_info: Definitely poorly aged graphics even for a 2016 game, but the gameplay, story, and music are amazing. 3 playthroughs, including infinity easy level reset run.

title: Ys IX: Monstrum Nox
extra_info: The Ys game where you run around a city instead of the wild. I love the music, the characters and combat. 3 playthroughs, including 2 100% runs, and lunatic run.

title: Ys X: Nordics
extra_info: An interesting Ys game, as you only have 2 party members instead of the classic 6. This can make the fighting feel less varied, but the other elements of the game makes up for it. 2 playthroughs, including inferno run.
